newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks surge on land liquidity news.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks surge on land liquidity news.

text.p: Tokyo stocks surged in Tuesday morning trade, inspired by comments by the Finance Ministry that a scheme to improve land liquidity would be announced by the end of March, brokers said.
After 22 minutes of trade, the Nikkei 225 was up 271.22 points or 1.50 percent at 18,324.72. Its June futures were up 260 points at 18,320.

"The market is very sensitive to land-related news," said Yasuo Ueki, general manager at Nikko Securities. "But foreign investors seem to be net sellers today and it is mostly dealers who are buying now, so momentum may not last."
